pullRequest.title: EBP: Improve styles for selection session item summary page
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist


 the contributor license agreement is signed
 commit message follows commit guidelines
 screenshots are included showing significant UI changes

Description of change

Made alignment of the item summary panel consistent across browsers (width: fit-content was used before, needed to add width: -moz-fit-content to make them work the same)
Fixed the alignment of the navbar (some of the text and part of the logo were cut off before)
Fixed alignment of the Select Summary Page button to be to the right of the Item title.
The summary/details tab bar divider now goes across the full length rather than roughly halfway
Realigned the help text within the help button (before when that was shown it would cut off the first word of every line)
Fixed faint line above Save button
Made the Select Summary Page button round and the same size as the others
Aligned the right side of the comment text box to the rest of the content in the panel
Hidden a divider on the Selection Panel between the buttons and the destination tree
Aligned the selection panel vertically to the resource summary panel rather than the tabs (only applied to the resource summary selection session page)

Before:

After:

commit.message: Improve styles for selection session item summary page

nodes.bodyText: That's a curious magical number. Is that a function of something?

Mostly this file uses rem units when dealing with fonts and lines. Any chance we could do the same here? There's a chance the value may then (and probably should) correlate with one of the typography mixins.

This 97% rings a bell. We've seen that in here before and then seen it removed as it wasn't really needed - could've been somewhere else. But, it raises the question, do we need this and how fragile will that 3% buffer be?

Did you notice that 4px is now in this file 155 times! 🤯
I wonder what it means. I can see it's half of $singleMargin but I'm not sure that's what it's representing. Feels more like it's a minimal buffer, minimal padding.... Not sure. 🤔
Wouldn't it be great to tidy that up.

commit.message: Use typography-button for the roundButton mixin
